page.title: 16FLETCHWOOD MEADOWS
page.content: Fletchwood Meadows is a nature reserve owned by the Hampshire and I.O.W. Naturalists Trust. It is 5.5 hectares in extent and was bought in November 1984 for Â£3O,OOO. There are four meadows within the site which lies between Bartley Water and the main London to Bournemouth railway line. The soils vary in wetness between the meadows and seventeen species of plants typical of ancient and unimproved meadows are present on the site. The idea behind the nature reserve is to retain farming in the traditional manner without use of chemicals, and to prevent ploughing which would most likely happen otherwise on these sandy loams. There are a large number of anthills present which leads to a greater variety of species of plants. Access is allowable by permit.
